basics.name: Philip Johnson
basics.label: Professor
basics.summary: I am a Professor of Information and Computer Sciences at the University of Hawaii, Director of the Collaborative Software Development Laboratory, and CEO of OpenPowerQuality.com.

work.summary: Department of Information and Computer Sciences
Co-founder and leader of technical development

highlights: International Journal of Computer Supported Cooperative Work, 1997-2004
Member, Technical Advisory Board, Sixth Sense Analytics, 2006-2009
Member, Board of Directors, Hawaii Strategic Development Corporation, 2006-2009
Member, Board of Directors, LavaNet, Inc., 2002-2005
Member, Board of Directors, High Technology Development Corporation, 2000-2004
International Workshop on In-Process Software Engineering Measurement and Analysis, 2007
International Workshop on Software Engineering for High Performance Computing System Applications, 2004, 2005
International Software Engineering Research Network Annual Meeting, 2000
Software Architectures for Cooperative Systems Workshop, ACM Conference on Computer Supported Cooperative Work, 1994
CSCW Tools and Technologies Workshop, European Conference on Computer Supported Cooperative Work, 1993
CSCW Tools and Technologies Workshop, ACM Conference on Computer Supported Cooperative Work, 1992
Collaborated on software metrics and software development behavioral research.
